subject: Languages
title: Phonology Without Sound
description: Learn Phonology Without Sound in one minute.

hook.text: Sign languages have 'phonology' â€” the study of smallest meaningful units. But there are no phones involved.

buildup.text: In spoken language, phonemes are sounds. In sign language, they're handshapes, locations, and movements.

discovery.text: Changing just the handshape of a sign can change its meaning â€” like changing a vowel changes a word.

twist.text: Sign language 'tongue twisters' exist â€” sequences of signs that are hard to produce accurately.

climax.text: Sign language phonology proved that language structure doesn't depend on sound at all.

punchline.text: Language has phonology even when nobody makes a sound. The rules run deeper than ears.
